para.text: An external management system for source code files. The source management facilities in Dolphin allow for packages to be exported from an image and saved to disk as a number of separate source files. These can be put under the control of a source code control system so that changes made over time, or by multiple developers, can be tracked in a central repository. Dolphin can be used successfully in conjunction with a number of file based source code systems such as Microsoft
Note that Dolphin Professional has a sophisticated method-level Source Tracking System built-in, thus alleviating the need to use an external SCCS in most situations.
